alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 11:32AM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 129 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 129 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms developing over the Riverside mountains around Idyllwild extending south to the Palomar mountains in northern San Diego County. Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Monitor for possible flash flood warnings should heavy rainfall persist. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Anza, Idyllwild-Pine Cove, Mt San Jacinto State Park, Hwy 243 Between Banning And Idyllwild, Hwy 74 Between Mountain Center And Anza, Hwy 79 Between Oak Grove And Aguanga, Mountain Center, Hwy 79 Between Warner Springs And Oak Grove, Aguanga and Hwy 74 Between Hemet And Mountain Center. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
